event.summary: 03/19/1993: The Azanian Liberation Army killed two white people and injured three more during a rush hour attack.
event.motive: The Azanian group advocates for the overthrow of the white minority government in South Africa.
event.weapdetail: AK-47 assault rifles were used in the attack.
event.addnotes: The Azanian Liberation Army claimed that it carried out several gun and bomb attacks previously on white people that resulted in the death of 5 people last year. The Azanian group is the military wing of the radical Pan Africanist Congress. At least 4 men fired on two vehicles. The attack resulted in three injuries and two casualties. One women in a separate vehicle escaped injury.
event.scite1: Tom Cohen, “Two Whites Killed, Three Injured, in Apparent Racial Attack,” The Associated Press, March 19, 1993.
event.scite2: “Attack on South African Motorists Kills Two,” Orlando Sentinel, March 20, 1993.
